author: Jami Harms

review: I am happy with the Fire Stick.  The simplicity of the remote. The installation was a breeze. I am looking forward to trying this at our cottage and see how it works there. I am still taking advantage of all the prime shows. I did buy the voice remote and have commented on that.(not real impressed with that. It is a waste of money)  However for the Fire Stick it is a good value for the money.  The only thing I do not like is that it is not very user friendly to those that are blind.  One of the members of my household is blind and still enjoys television.  The fire stick does not have descriptive video service like blue rays have.  It is very difficult for the blind family member to navigate the tv menus. Because the remote or fire stick  does not talk back. Like a smart phone or computer will.  The voice remote only listens to what you say to it. There is no voice playback on the fire stick to tell you what menu or movie you are on. If you do get this product for the blind of visually impaired and you are budget conscious, you will want to set the parental controls so that non prime shows and apps are not accidentally purchased. The fire stick is great to catch up on  shows.  I am still toying around with it and learning the benefits of the product.
